image withFile.description: Sets another image for this handler to work on. Keeps us from needing to continually instantiate the handler.

image getResource.description: Returns the temporary image used during the image processing. Good for extending the system or doing things this library is not intended to do.

image withResource.description: Load the temporary image used during the image processing. Some functions e.g. save() will only copy and not compress your image otherwise.

image crop.description: Crops the image to the desired height and width. If one of the height/width values is not provided, that value will be set the appropriate value based on offsets and image dimensions.

image convert.description: Changes the stored image type to indicate the new file format to use when saving. Does not touch the actual resource.

image rotate.description: Rotates the image on the current canvas.

image flip.description: Flips an image either horizontally or vertically.

image text.description: Overlays a string of text over the image.

image reorient.description: Reads the EXIF information from the image and modifies the orientation so that displays correctly in the browser. This is especially an issue with images taken by smartphones who always store the image up-right, but set the orientation flag to display it correctly.

image getEXIF.description: Retrieve the EXIF information from the image, if possible. Returns an array of the information, or null if nothing can be found.

image fit.description: Combine cropping and resizing into a single command.

image getVersion.description: Get the version of the image library in use.

image save.description: Saves any changes that have been made to file.
